thread.title: Amber Rose 'has been sued by strip club' | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Amber Rose 'has been sued by strip club' | Daily Mail Online

author: Christine Rendon For Dailymail.Com
title: Amber Rose 'has been sued by strip club' | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 147 shares However the owners of Ace Of Diamonds, who insist they have not sold the establishment to anyone, are suing Amber for slander. Adding to the confusion, Amber says she plans on opening a new strip club under the same name within the next two months. Making a statement: While speaking at the All Def Movie Awards on Wednesday night, the former stripper made the announcement and immediately walked off stage to a stunned crowd Amber surprised her fans when she announced at the All Def Movie Awards earlier this month that she had bought Ace Of Diamonds. It is one of Hollywood's most prestigious strip clubs, attracting A-list stars from Drake to Khloe Kardashian. 'Do y'all know Ace of Diamonds?' she boasted in a video uploaded to Instagram. 'Well, I bought it.' Nicki Minaj, Meek Mill, Chris Brown, Tyga, Scott Disick and Karrueche Tran have all been spotted at the club. After Rob Kardashian popped the question to Blac Chyna the couple even celebrated their engagement at the Lclub. Entrepreneur! Amber - pictured with Blac Chyna and India Love - purchased one of Hollywood's most prestigious strip clubs that attract A-list stars from Drake to Khloe Kardashian Romantic rendezvous? Rob Kardashian popped the question to Blac over dinner and then the couple celebrated at the Los Angeles club on April 13 last year And Amber herself has long had ties to the venue. Indeed last summer, the talk show host and her ex-husband Wiz Khalifa - who have son Sebastian, four, together - celebrated reaching a divorce settlement at Ace of Diamonds, and the pair spent $30,000 on strippers. She has also hosted themed nights at the club. Intriguingly, at the venue, the club's operator Jason Robertson called Amber the 'boss lady'. Night out: The ladies hit up Ace Of Diamonds strip club earlier this month 'Her role is the boss lady,' he told E! News , adding that she was his business partner and owns 60per cent of the business. 'She is bringing in these dancers and these women and hostesses are having women's rights more than what they had before. 'It's not going to be them treated like pieces of meat. She's brought in more of a structure where you have to respect what they're doing. With that, I can't say no to that.' Make it rain! Ace of Diamonds is a popular strip club which is frequented by celebrities Talk about a night out! Guests crowded around dancers on stage at the club
